question: my knee is hurting real bad? plz help?
question_content: i was playing soccer in summer and when i run for about 30 minutes my knee will start hurting, i thought it was a sprained, but i kept running and realy didnt care for about 6 months and i fell like 2 times and now i cant even bend it and it hurts badly, do i need a surgery?

answers.answer_content: I do not know. You need to see a a knee specialist and get an mri so he/she can see whats up with ur knee before donig any kkind of surgery.

Try to do the duck walk. If you can't do it without having severe pain, you most likely have torn cartilage, which does require surgery. If you feel a "click" in the back of your knee while you walk/run it may be torn meniscus. Anywho, go to the doctor and get an MRI.

I had a similar thing happen when I was in tae-kwon-do classes.  I eventually got to the point to where I couldn't bend my knee- it was stuck in one position.  I had to ice it and take anti-inflammatory medicine.  It turns out I have Patello-Femoral Syndrome- basically my kneecap isn't lined up properly with my femur.  my doctor gave me some stretches to improve flexiblity, and also advised I ease up on my knee.  He also suggested doing weight training on my quads, thighs to help align everything properly.

I definitely suggest going to a sports doctor, but if you don't have the funds to do so, jus ease up a bit on your workouts.  If you start to feel pain, slow down or walk, and make sure to take some anti-inflammatory medicine, and ice your knee daily.  

One stretch that helped me- 

Lie on the ground on your back.  Lift your right knee to your chest and hold in there for a few seconds- repeat with your left knee.  This stretch will help your quads.  

Good Luck!
Obviously there is a problem.  Go to the doctor and get a proper diagnosis and treatment.  This could have long term effects.
